decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana through cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cheat out powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for key pieces like The One Ring and Malevolent Rumble, while also ensuring protection with Boseiju, Who Endures. By utilizing land synergy and combo pieces like Scapeshift and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, the deck is able to create explosive turns and overwhelm opponents with a powerful board state.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and combo off with Primeval Titan to search for specific lands and win conditions quickly. By utilizing lands like Urza's Saga and The One Ring, the deck is able to assemble key pieces and set up powerful plays. The combination of mana ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore, along with powerful lands like Lotus Field and Simic Growth Chamber, allows the deck to consistently ramp and establish a strong board presence. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and win the game.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. Utilizing powerful creatures like Ocelot Pride and Amped Raptor, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Static Prison and Blood Moon help to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and The One Ring provide additional support and strength to the board. Overall, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard. Tamiyo, Emry, and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and fuel the graveyard, while Grinding Station and Urza's Saga help to mill and tutor for combo pieces. The goal is to eventually win the game through a loop of casting Mishra's Bauble and The One Ring, with Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat providing disruption and removal along the way. The deck relies on precise sequencing and careful resource management to execute the combo successfully.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays supported by removal spells and disruption to control the board. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of cheap and powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Chained to the Rocks and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and synergy with the creature-heavy strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of counter spells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By continuously disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Snare, Fatal Push, and Counterspell, the deck aims to maintain control of the board and create opportunities to pressure the opponent with cards like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. Additionally, the deck utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Unearth and Thought Scour to gain additional value and maintain card advantage throughout the game.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and controlling the board through card advantage and efficient removal. The deck aims to outlast opponents with a combination of counterspells, removal spells like Fatal Push, and efficient creatures like Psychic Frog and Abhorrent Oculus. By using a mix of disruption and card advantage, the deck looks to control the game until it can establish a win condition and close out the game.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to utilize a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, combined with strong finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Soul Spike, the deck aims to maintain control of the board and win through incremental advantage. The deck also includes a mix of reanimation spells like Necrodominance and The Meathook Massacre to further solidify its control over the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing a mix of powerful creatures and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha provides additional value and flexibility. The deck combines creatures with abilities that buff each other, alongside removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, to control the board and maintain pressure. The single copy of Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer adds a versatile threat, while cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the goal is to establish a fast-paced offense and maintain board control to secure victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects while building card advantage with Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. Using disruptive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Harbinger of the Seas to keep the opponent in check, it aims to outgrind the opponent in a long game. The deck also includes versatile cards like Subtlety and Go for the Throat to deal with a variety of threats. The mana base is designed to consistently hit its color requirements and maintain flexibility in its spell choices.

This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost creatures like Mockingbird and Ocelot Pride to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Galvanic Discharge to maintain board control and deal additional damage. The inclusion of Ranger-Captain of Eos and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah allows for card advantage and the ability to quickly pump up creatures for a lethal attack. The deck also features disruption elements like Static Prison to slow down the opponent.

This deck focuses on using combo pieces and card manipulation to generate powerful spells and abilities without relying on traditional land cards. It utilizes cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Lotus Bloom to quickly ramp up mana, while also including cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Whir of Invention for powerful win conditions. The deck incorporates counterspells and card draw to control the game and ensure its combo pieces can be utilized effectively. With a focus on powerful spells and abilities, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through clever manipulation of resources.

The deck focuses on using powerful control spells and creatures to dominate the opponent. It utilizes cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Boggart Trawler to maintain board presence while cards like Soul Spike and Fell the Profane drain the opponent's resources. The One Ring provides a solid win condition, while Fatal Push and Inquisition of Kozilek help control the opponent's board. Agadeem's Awakening and Necrodominance offer powerful late-game plays, while Thoughtseize provides disruption. The deck also includes cards like Revitalizing Repast and March of Wretched Sorrow for additional utility. A strong mono-black control deck that aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly using rituals and ramp effects like Manamorphose and Ruby Medallion. It then utilizes Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy spells and deal damage to opponents, along with cards like March of Reckless Joy and Valakut Awakening for card advantage and combo potential. The deck also includes Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard, as well as Wish to fetch important pieces. Overall, the goal is to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and burn damage.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to control the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plan while establishing board presence with The One Ring and other powerful cards. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect your own spells and prevent the opponent from playing at instant speed. By controlling the game through card advantage, removal, and disruptive elements, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal while generating incremental card advantage and mana acceleration through artifacts like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Amber, and Urza, Lord High Artificer. The use of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch further enhances card advantage and control over the game. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to search for artifacts and create token creatures for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting using a mix of artifacts and spells to dominate the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of red, green, and white creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds consistency and flexibility to the deck. By efficiently utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to establish board control early and close out the game swiftly. Leyline cards provide additional support and protection, while the mana base allows for smooth casting of spells across multiple colors.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifact creatures and pumping them up with equipment and enchantments to create a fast and aggressive board presence. By utilizing cards like Springleaf Drum and Urza's Saga to generate mana, the deck can quickly flood the board with threats like Moonsnare Prototype and Nettlecyst. With an emphasis on affinity for artifacts, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and powerful equipment like Shadowspear and Lavaspur Boots. The goal is to hit hard and fast, overwhelming the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on using the Amulet of Vigor to generate mana quickly and efficiently, while utilizing Primeval Titan to search for key lands and combo pieces. The goal is to ramp up mana production and create explosive turns by playing multiple lands in a single turn, eventually assembling the necessary pieces to bring out powerful creatures like Cultivator Colossus and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods. The deck also includes various utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to support the combo strategy and ensure consistency in executing its game plan.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast, aggressive creatures such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Amped Raptor, supported by powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Galvanic Discharge. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Blood Moon to control the game and prevent the opponent from developing their board. With a focus on quick, efficient attacking strategies, this deck aims to quickly outpace and overpower the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for more consistency in casting the deck's powerful creatures. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats that can quickly close out the game. With powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, along with disruption from Blood Moon and Static Prison, this deck aims to control the board while steadily decreasing the opponent's life total to emerge victorious.

The deck focuses on utilizing creature tutor cards like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures that can combo together to create powerful synergies and win conditions. It includes a mix of utility creatures like Viscera Seer and Gilded Goose, along with key combo pieces like Cauldron Familiar and Samwise Gamgee. The deck also features mana ramp creatures like Wildgrowth Walker to help accelerate into its combo pieces faster. The lands are carefully selected to ensure consistent mana base for casting the creatures and spells needed to execute the combo strategy effectively.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creature cards that can be used to generate various combos and interactions, leading to a toolbox-like approach to gameplay. The key strategy involves using cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Delighted Halfling to control the board, while also utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Grist, the Hunger Tide to search for specific creatures needed in different situations. Additionally, the deck includes synergistic cards such as Zulaport Cutthroat and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to provide alternative win conditions and value.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using a variety of counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing graveyard recursion with Unearth and Thought Scour to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to control the pace of the game by denying the opponent key threats and resources, ultimately outlasting them and securing a win through attrition. The combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and powerful counterspells like Force of Negation allows the deck to handle a wide range of threats and strategies in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. A key combo involves sacrificing a creature like Psychic Frog to put it into the graveyard, and then bringing it back with Atraxa, Grand Unifier to draw cards and gain card advantage. Cards like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize help protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win through overwhelming the opponent with big creatures and controlling the board with removal spells.

The deck aims to win the game through a unique combo utilizing Hydroelectric Specimen and Lotus Bloom to generate mana, then casting Goblin Charbelcher to deal immense damage to the opponent. The strategy involves using counterspells like Force of Negation and Disrupting Shoal to protect the combo pieces, while also controlling the opponent's board with cards like Subtlety and Thundertrap Trainer. The deck has no lands, relying instead on cantrips like Preordain and card draw spells like Sea Gate Restoration to find the necessary pieces for the combo.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and efficient creature removal. By utilizing creatures with powerful abilities like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, along with instant removal spells like Thoughtseize and Galvanic Discharge, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional versatility and synergy with the deck's mana base. By maintaining a fast-paced and proactive strategy, this Mardu Aggro deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, board wipes, and removal while also utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Nulldrifter. The inclusion of Dress Down and Consign to Memory adds flexibility and disruption to opponent strategies. The centerpiece of the deck is The One Ring, which can provide a powerful advantage with its abilities. The deck also includes Teferi, Time Raveler for additional control and card advantage. With a mixture of control elements and powerful threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in the long game.

This deck focuses on using powerful removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage to control the game until The One Ring can be played. The One Ring serves as the win condition, creating a difficult-to-remove threat. The deck includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Nulldrifter for additional pressure and card advantage. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler for more control options. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue opponents in order to secure victory.

This deck focuses on locking down the opponent's board with cards like Static Prison and Leyline Binding, while generating value with cards like Six','','');">Wrenn and Six and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The win condition revolves around using The One Ring to control the game and closing it out with powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes plenty of removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and dominate the board with strong control elements.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key concept revolves around utilizing The One Ring card as a central piece to control the game and generate advantage. This control archetype aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and deploying powerful threats of its own, such as Nulldrifter and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck seeks to establish dominance through precise decision-making and resource management to emerge victorious in 1 vs 1 matchups.

This UR Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game and ultimately win through powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Crackling Drake. With a mix of creature threats and powerful spells, the deck is designed to adapt to different matchups and control the pace of the game. With efficient removal and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through careful planning and tactical play.

This deck focuses on utilizing the companion ability of Jegantha, the Wellspring while also using a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu. The deck also includes powerful threats like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm opponents. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames for reach and disruption like Stubborn Denial, Leyline Binding, and Leyline of the Guildpact for protection, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with cheap artifacts. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Springleaf Drum, and Ornithopter to generate mana and draw cards, the deck aims to quickly ramp up to strong threats like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. Urza's Saga and Darksteel Citadel provide additional mana and resilient threats, while Portable Hole and Sink into Stupor help control the opponent's board. The goal is to establish dominance early and snowball into a quick victory.

This deck aims to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to enable powerful ramping with cards like Primeval Titan and The One Ring, allowing for explosive plays and quickly assembling lethal combinations like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble. The deck utilizes lands like Urza's Saga, Lotus Field, and Gruul Turf to generate mana advantage and set up game-winning turns. With the ability to tutor for key pieces with cards like Summoner's Pact and Tolaria West, the deck can consistently threaten to win the game through overwhelming board presence and unstoppable combos.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet Titan combo to produce a large amount of mana and play powerful lands and creatures quickly. The key concept involves ramping up mana production with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, searching for key pieces with cards like Summoner's Pact and Urza's Saga, and using Primeval Titan to fetch powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva to deal damage. The strategy involves using the synergy between lands and creatures to overpower the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the powerful Amulet Titan combo by quickly ramping up mana, tutoring for key pieces, and enabling explosive plays. Utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to cheat out giant threats and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive land drops and combo potential. By efficiently tutoring for key lands and utilizing synergistic pieces like Arboreal Grazer and Explore, the deck can set up game-winning plays and create a dominating board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Explore, and Amulet of Vigor to cast Primeval Titan and search for powerful lands such as Gruul Turf, Lotus Field, and Urza's Saga. These lands will generate an incredible amount of value, allowing the player to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state. The combo potential is further enhanced by cards like Aftermath Analyst and Cultivator Colossus, creating a synergy between the various lands and creatures in the deck.

The deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to cast Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor to create explosive turns. The goal is to assemble the combo of The One Ring and Primeval Titan to search for powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, enabling a win condition with landfall triggers or creating a powerful board presence. The inclusion of other utility lands and spells like Expedition Map and Summoner's Pact allow for flexibility and consistency in executing the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing Primeval Titan to tutor for utility lands and combo pieces, such as The One Ring and Amulet of Vigor, to ramp up mana and generate value. It aims to establish a board presence quickly with the help of cards like Arboreal Grazer and Urza's Saga, while also having options for protection and interaction with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Malevolent Rumble. The deck seeks to assemble key pieces efficiently to create a dominant board state and overwhelm opponents with powerful interactions and threats.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the field with low-cost creatures like Guide of Souls, Ocelot Pride, and Amped Raptor while supporting them with powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides additional value, and cards like The One Ring and Galvanic Discharge help maintain board control. Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment offer additional removal options, while cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggression and efficient card synergy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on an aggressive strategy, utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Amped Raptor to quickly damage the opponent. With cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer providing additional threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its speed and efficiency. The inclusion of Static Prison and Lightning Bolt help to control the board while The One Ring and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach for closing out games. Overall, the deck aims to be fast and relentless in its pursuit of victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on playing low cost creatures like Guide of Souls, Ocelot Pride, and Amped Raptor to quickly build a board presence. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional support and damage potential. Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge offer removal and direct damage, while Static Prison and Blood Moon disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to win the game quickly through early aggression and efficient combat strategies.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature cards like Guide of Souls, Ocelot Pride, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by powerful enchantments like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The inclusion of removal spells like Skyclave Apparition and Chained to the Rocks help control the board while cards like Galvanic Discharge and The One Ring provide additional damage. Blood Moon can disrupt opponents' mana bases, while Static Prison can lock down threats. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production for the aggressive game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck includes a powerful companion creature, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional support. The key strategy is to maintain board presence and apply pressure early in the game, using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Lightning Bolt to control the board and deal damage. Supporting cards like Arid Mesa and Sacred Foundry ensure consistent mana sources for the aggro strategy to succeed.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards that limit the opponent's options and disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds versatility to the deck's mana base. The key concept is to apply early pressure, maintain board control, and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck aims to win through combat damage by efficiently utilizing its creatures and spells in a Boros-colored aggro archetype.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with diverse abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By utilizing cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, the deck can generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Chord of Calling allows for flexibility in tutoring up key creatures when needed. With a mix of sacrifice synergies and creature recursion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish board control while setting up for potential combo finishes.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counter spells and removal while controlling the board with creatures like Psychic Frog and Abhorrent Oculus. The deck also utilizes cards like Consider and Thought Scour to dig for answers and threats, as well as Unearth to recur key creatures. Murktide Regent provides a powerful finisher while Shoot the Sheriff and Sink into Stupor offer additional disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements for its spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by controlling the board with a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Counterspell, while also using cards like Psychic Frog and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent's life total. By utilizing a combination of counterspells and removal, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent by answering their threats and preventing them from executing their game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog. It also utilizes control elements such as board wipes and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Devourer of Destiny provide additional value and threats to the board. The deck's main objective is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and control their board while setting up for a win condition with cards like Through the Breach or Ugin's Labyrinth.

The deck revolves around ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. By using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse, the deck can quickly accelerate to cast massive threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and World Breaker help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like All Is Dust provide board wipes for protection. The combination of ramp and control allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with huge threats while keeping the opponent's board under control.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of powerful Eldrazi creatures and ramping up your mana production to cast them quickly. By utilizing cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate your mana, you can unleash devastating threats such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The inclusion of Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble also allows you to disrupt your opponent's strategy and maintain control of the battlefield. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with massive creatures while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp cards to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The combination of control elements and Eldrazi threats allows for disruption and pressure at the same time. Emrakul, the Promised End and other big Eldrazi creatures are the win conditions, while cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble provide board control. The deck also includes mana acceleration and fixing to ensure consistent plays. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping into Eldrazi threats and controlling the board to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build up your infect creatures using pump spells and protect them with counterspells and protection spells. By utilizing cards like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with powerful pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth, you can deliver lethal poison counters to your opponent. The addition of cards like Spellskite and Vines of Vastwood helps protect your creatures from removal spells, allowing you to focus on quickly overwhelming your opponent with infect damage.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and utilizing various abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, along with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. Cards like Static Prison and Skyclave Apparition provide additional control over the board, while The One Ring offers a potential game-winning boost. By combining speed, power, and disruption, the Jeskai Aggro deck aims to establish dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing a wide range of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive strategies. Key components include powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, as well as efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thoughtseize. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility and consistency in the deck's gameplay. By combining strong creatures, removal, and strategic choices, this Mardu Aggro deck aims to control the board and dominate the battlefield.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ocelot Pride, Guide of Souls, and Amped Raptor to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Galvanic Discharge to maintain board control. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional utility and consistency as a companion. The deck's strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Static Prison. Additionally, cards like Ob Nixilis, the Adversary and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and finishing power.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate red mana through cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. The deck utilizes Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy spells and generate massive storm counts, allowing for explosive plays and potentially game-winning combos. The inclusion of cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Past in Flames help to refill the hand and continue casting spells. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high volume of spells and finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with ritual spells and mana producers like Ruby Medallion to cast multiple spells in one turn. It utilizes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw through the deck and find combo pieces like Past in Flames. The deck aims to eventually cast a huge storm count and finish the game with a lethal March of Reckless Joy or other burn spells. Jegantha, the Wellspring is included as a companion to provide additional mana and utility.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion, Manamorphose, Desperate Ritual, and Pyretic Ritual, in order to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage, and Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes cards like Questing Druid and Wish to help find key pieces for the combo. Additionally, cards like Valakut Awakening and Past in Flames allow for card draw and graveyard recursion. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with high-powered spells.

The deck aims to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful enchantments like The One Ring and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. It seeks to stall the opponent's strategies while setting up its own win condition with The One Ring. Cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies help deal with threats on the board, while cards like Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional control options. The mana base is designed to support the deck's various colors and requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and maintaining control of the game.

This Modern UB Mill deck focuses on using creatures like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's deck while controlling the board with counterspells like Drown in the Loch and removal like Fatal Push. The deck also includes powerful mill cards like Archive Trap and Glimpse the Unthinkable to quickly mill the opponent's library. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent by milling their deck as quickly as possible, using cards like Tasha's Hideous Laughter and Fractured Sanity to finish the game.

This control deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana. The deck then plays powerful Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and World Breaker to control the game. Karn, the Great Creator is used to shut down the opponent's artifacts, while cards like Trinisphere and All Is Dust disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also runs a unique win condition in The One Ring, providing an alternate path to victory.
